III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/2/24, a youth eloped from the facility and was seen walking
down a road, holding a knife and threatening to kill himself. After
approximately 15 minutes, a staff member came to pick the youth
up.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 07/03/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 07/03/2024, but the
number provided was a main business line.
Foster Care Worker was notified of the incident via email on
07/03/2024.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed at the facility on
07/03/2024, in conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. CA confirmed
Youth A AWOLed from campus on 07/02/2024 and Staff 1
followed Youth A until he lost sight of Youth A on 6-mile road. The
Police were on campus due to a building issue and therefore they
were informed of Youth A leaving campus. Police started looking
for Youth A, but Youth A returned to campus on his own within 30
minutes. Youth A didn’t have a knife on him. CA reported staff did
follow the facility AWOL policy and staff were supervising Youth A
when he AWOLed off campus. She said Supervisor completed an
incident report and searched Youth A after he returned to campus.
Youth A did leave without shoes and therefore had a small cut on
his foot from walking barefoot. CA said Youth A was hospitalized
last weekend due to having suicidal thoughts. Youth A was
cleared and discharged. CA reported Youth A had medication
review this morning and the doctor did adjust his medication.
2

Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 07/03/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 14 years old and
has been at the facility for 2 years. Youth A reported on
07/02/2024 he got upset while working on a group project and
AWOLed from campus. Youth A said he left the cottage without
his shoes. Youth A said Staff 1 followed him up to 6-mile road.
Youth A said he grabbed a small sharp rock or metal piece off the
ground and Staff 1 took it away from him. Youth A admitted to
calling Staff 1 a “bitch” and telling Staff 1 he was going to cut
himself and blame Staff 1 for cutting him. Youth A said Staff 1 told
him if he wanted to kill himself, he should use a knife. Youth A
said he walked away from Staff 1 and headed down 6-mile road.
Youth A went to the dollar store to get a box cutter but found that
the dollar store does not sell box cutters. Youth A started walking
back to campus, when a stranger stopped their car and asked
Youth A if he needed shoes. Youth A refused the shoes and
headed back to campus. Youth A admitted he was feeling sad, but
denied he had a knife. Youth A said when he got back to campus
Supervisor searched him and cleaned up a scab on his foot.
Youth A denied currently feeling suicidal.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 07/15/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a Youth Specialist
and has worked at the facility for 15 months. Staff 1 recalled the
incident involving Youth A AWOLing on 07/02/2024. He reported
Youth A was mad because he was breaking the markers during a
group project. Youth A left the cottage without his shoes. Staff 1
followed Youth A to the front of the campus. Youth A picked up a
small rock and threaten to cut himself. Staff 1 told Youth A to drop
the rock and encouraged Youth A not to hurt himself. Youth A
dropped the rock and left the campus. Staff 1 adamantly denied
telling Youth A to use a knife to hurt himself. Staff 1 said he had a
niece that committed suicide and would never encourage a youth
to harm themselves. Staff 1 said he returned to campus and
informed the police that were onsite that Youth A had AWOLed.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 07/15/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor reported she was
working on 07/02/2024 and assisted Youth A when he returned to
campus after AWOLing. She denied Youth A had a knife or was
threatening to hurt himself. She said Youth A AWOLed without
shoes and had a small cut on his foot, which she cleaned up and
applied a band-aid. Youth A appeared to be in good spirits and did
not express any concerns regarding Staff 1 or any other staff
member.
3

Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 07/15/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B is in the same
cottage with Youth A. Youth B recalled Youth A AWOLing and
when he came back Youth A said he was going to lie on Staff 1.
Youth B reported feeling safe and expressed no concerns
regarding Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 07/16/2024, in
conjunction with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported she was
working with Staff 1 on 07/02/2024. She said on 07/02/2024 Staff
1 followed Youth A when he AWOLed. Staff 2 denied Youth A
returned to campus with a knife. Staff 2 said she consistently
works with Staff 1 and Staff 1 has never encouraged a youth to
use a knife to self-harm or said anything inappropriate to the
youths on 07/02/2024.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 07/02/2024 completed by Staff 1.
Type of incident AWOL. Youth A was asked by Staff 1 not
to destroy the markers used in group. Youth A got mad,
called staff “dick sucking bitches” and AWOLed from the
cottage. Staff 1 followed Youth A up to 6 Mile Road.
• Incident reported dated 07/02/2024 completed by
Supervisor. Youth A returned to campus from AWOL.
Youth A had small cut on his foot. Youth A went AWOL
without shoes.
• Psychological evaluation dated 07/03/2024 for Youth A
completed by Dr. Fouche-Brazzle. Youth A diagnosed with
PTSD, Major Depressive Disorder, ADHD, and Disruptive
Mood Dysregulation Disorder.
• Corwell Health discharge summary dated 06/23/2024, for
Youth A. Reason for visit is suicidal ideation and
aggressive behavior.
• Agency AWOL policy. Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as
far as possible without endangering their own safety. If
youths retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight
of them, the police should be contacted, a missing person’s
report filed, and when a youth returns to campus notify
police.
4

• Agency policy: Child Supervision: 2. Agency schedules
staff to maintain a 4:1 ratio.
• Personnel file for Staff 1- no disciplinary action.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, the staff followed Youth A when he AWOLed off
campus. There is no evidence that Youth A had a knife.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
